domain Module¶

class domain.BaseDomain(extent=array([ 1., 1., 1.]), cell_count=1)[source]¶

Base class for simulation domain, cartesian, 3D.

Parameters:
  • extent – [x,y,z] numpy array with extents of simulation domain.
  • cellcount – (Integer) Number of cells within domain.
boundary_correct(input_state)¶

Return a new position accounting for periodic boundaries. Would probably benefit from being in C.

Parameters:r_in – np.array(1,3) input position
cell_array(cell_array)¶

Return cell array.

cell_count()¶

Return cell count for domain.

cell_index_lin(C_in)¶

Convert tuple index to linear index. Applies periodic boundaries first.

Parameters:c_in – Input index to convert.
cell_index_lin_offset(C_in_abs)¶

Convert tuple index to linear index. Applies periodic boundaries first. Returns periodic boundary offsets.

Parameters:c_in_abs – Input index to convert.
cell_index_tuple(c_in)¶

Convert cell linear index to vector.

Parameters:c_in – (int) Input index.
extent()[source]¶

Returns list of domain extents.

get_adjacent_cells(ix)¶

Returns the 14 neighbouring cells as linear index.

Parameters:ix – (int) Input index.
get_cell_lin_index(r_in)¶

Returns the linear cell index for a given input coordinate.

Parameters:r_in – (np.array(3,1)) Cartesian vector for particle position.
set_cell_array_explicit(cell_array)¶

Set cell array with a vector.

Parameters:cell_array – (np.array(1,3), new cell array.)
set_cell_array_radius(rn)¶

Create cell structure based on current extent and extended cutoff distance.

Parameters:rn – (float) rn=rc+δ
set_extent(new_extent=array([ 1., 1., 1.]))¶

Set domain extents

Parameters:new_extent – (np.shape(1,3)) New extents.
volume()¶

Return domain volume.
